layers.name: Context Layer
layers.description: Foundational information about the input (voice/audio data) and user personalization
layers.usage: Always applied - both files in this layer are always included in every stack

elements.name: foundational
elements.instruction: The audio file provided in the prompt contains a voice recording provided by the user. Your task is to process it acccording to these formatting instructions in order to produce a text in the desired format and style.

elements.name: personalisation
elements.instruction: The user's name is Daniel

layers.name: Baseline Layer
layers.usage: Typically always applied - generally included in all stacks unless explicitly omitted

elements.name: fix-typos
elements.instruction: Fix typos and grammatical errors that you encounter in the text provided.

elements.name: punctuation-and-paras
elements.instruction: Restore punctuation and add paragraph spacing.

layers.name: Reason-Based Layer
layers.description: Intelligent content filtering requiring inference (verbal corrections, unintended audio exclusion, repetition removal)
layers.usage: Optional, recommended - can include all files or select specific ones based on needs. These layers require the model to exercise judgment about user intent

elements.name: inferred-corrections
elements.instruction: When the user provides verbal instructions to modify the transcript (such as "scratch that", "don't include that in the transcript", "ignore what I just said", or similar directives), act upon these instructions by removing or modifying the content as directed. Do not include these meta-instructions themselves in the final output.

elements.name: non-transcribed-audio
elements.instruction: Infer and exclude audio content that was not intended for transcription, such as: greetings to other people, conversations with visitors, handling deliveries, background interruptions, side conversations, or other interactions that are clearly separate from the main dictation. Include only content that represents the user's intended message.

elements.name: repetition-avoidance
elements.instruction: Identify and remove redundant repetitions where the user expresses the same thought, idea, or instruction multiple times. If the user explicitly states they want to remove or not include something mentioned earlier, honor that instruction. Consolidate repeated concepts into a single, clear expression while preserving the user's intended meaning.

layers.name: Format Layer
layers.description: Output structure (email, documentation, to-do list, etc.)
layers.usage: Select one - choose exactly one format per stack

elements.name: email
elements.instruction: Format the text as a professional email with appropriate greeting and closing.

elements.name: todo-list
elements.instruction: Structure the text as a to-do list with actionable items.

elements.name: task-list
elements.instruction: Convert the text into a structured task list with clear deliverables.

elements.name: freeform-text
elements.instruction: Present the text as freeform prose without specific structural constraints.

elements.name: documentation
elements.instruction: Format the text as technical documentation with clear sections and structure.

layers.name: Tone Layer
layers.usage: Select one - choose exactly one tone per stack

elements.name: maximum-formality
elements.instruction: Apply maximum formality to the text, using formal language and structure.

elements.name: business-appropriate
elements.instruction: Ensure the tone is business-appropriate and professional.

elements.name: minimum-formality
elements.instruction: Apply minimum formality to the text, using casual and relaxed language.

elements.name: informal-interpersonal
elements.instruction: Use an informal tone suitable for interpersonal communication.

layers.name: Emotional Layer
layers.usage: Select one - choose exactly one emotional register per stack

elements.name: heightened-emotion
elements.instruction: Increase the emotional intensity and expressiveness of the text.

elements.name: neutral-emotion
elements.instruction: Maintain neutral emotional tone throughout the text.

elements.name: low-emotion
elements.instruction: Reduce emotional language and maintain a restrained tone.

layers.name: Style Layer
layers.description: Additional style modifiers (concise, verbose, technical, conversational)
layers.usage: Select one or more - can select multiple compatible style modifiers

elements.name: concise
elements.instruction: Make the text concise by removing unnecessary words while preserving meaning.

elements.name: verbose
elements.instruction: Expand the text with additional detail and explanation.

elements.name: technical
elements.instruction: Apply technical language and precise terminology appropriate to the subject.

elements.name: conversational
elements.instruction: Rewrite the text in a conversational, natural speaking style.

layers.name: Readability Layer
layers.usage: Select one - choose exactly one readability level per stack

elements.name: simple
elements.instruction: Simplify the text for easy comprehension by general audiences.

elements.name: intermediate
elements.instruction: Adjust the text to an intermediate readability level suitable for educated readers.

elements.name: advanced
elements.instruction: Increase complexity and sophistication for expert-level readers.
